text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in Norwegian newspapers this morning.
- Exports of salmon rose by 20 percent during the first four months of 1997 compared with the same year-ago period. Despite higher export volumes, revenues increased by only 12.3 percent.

- Fishermen from Chile are visiting Norway to fight against Aker RGI's fishing vessel, American Monarch, and other large fishing vessels from operating in Chile's 200-mile fishing zone. The Chilean crown court recently rejected Aker RGI's request for a licence to fish for blue whiting in the zone.
- America's CNN is considering starting up a Norwegian news service in 1997.

- Several hundred people demonstrated in Kristiansand in southern Norway on Thursday over large differences in the school system. A report shows great variation in school grants in the different counties.

- Savings bank group Sparebankgruppen extended by two weeks the deadline for its offer to takeover Fokus Bank. Sparebankgruppen is refusing to say how what percentage acceptance they have received so far from Fokus' shareholders, but most probably it controls no more than 51 percent.
- Norway's defence lacks computer expertise. Around 40-50 percent of computer-related defence jobs are vacant because of better salaries in the private sector.
